title: Add friend's photo to the beginning of the congratulatory page

requirements.text: Add the user-uploaded photo (IMG_0098.jpeg) to the app as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/ (optimized for web) so it can be used in the hero/top section.

quotes: Add this photo in the begging as it’s his photo and I want to congratulate to him

acceptanceCriteria: An optimized/cropped version of IMG_0098.jpeg is saved under frontend/public/assets/ (or a subfolder) and can be loaded via a /assets/... URL in the browser.
The image is compressed appropriately for web use (reasonable file size) while maintaining good visual quality.

requirements.text: Update the top of the page (HeroSection) to show Vivan Pathak’s photo first/at the beginning as the primary congratulatory visual, while keeping the existing Air India Express-inspired theme and ensuring the layout remains responsive on mobile and desktop.

quotes: Add this photo in the begging as it’s his photo and I want to congratulate to him

acceptanceCriteria: On initial page load, the hero/top section prominently displays the new photo before other hero visuals (e.g., above the headline or as the main image in the hero).
The image includes appropriate English alt text (e.g., referencing Vivan Pathak as provided by the user) and does not cause layout shifts or overflow on common screen sizes.
The hero section still looks balanced alongside the existing headline, stats cards, and styling on both mobile and desktop.

constraints: Do not modify files in frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep backend as single-actor; no backend changes are required for this static image addition.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication, data storage, or backend endpoints.
Changing existing highlight-card modal behavior beyond what is necessary to place the photo at the beginning of the page.

edits: Create a square portrait variant for smaller layouts if needed (IMG_0098.jpeg > vivan-portrait-square.dim_800x800.jpg)
